channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road never completed, 6th February
item.description:
The road outside our house was never completed, you can see where they started and stopped so one area was never completed despite multiple site viewings to start works. I have contacted Tewkesbury Council and persimmon homes who have directed me to you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowthorpe Drive, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping next to BT exchange, 6th February
item.description:
On the lane from Chosen Way to the back of the shops there is fly tipped rubbish. Most is in an abandoned trolley but there are monitors and various other bits dumped there too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Traffic Cone Roundabout, 6th February
item.description:
The traffic cone roundabout that has been installed is dangerous as it is causing massive issues for large vehicles. Large vehicles are unable to turn from Church Road onto the main road without moving the cones, or running them over. This is a very bad layout and needs urgent attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 159, Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW6 Potholes problem, 6th February
item.description:
Pothole CW 500mm x 500mm x 45mm Multi way stop and go TM On roundabout Best OOH Unable to mark due to volume of traffic (CW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drainage ditch completely blocked and overgrown, 6th February
item.description:
Opposite Sarnia, Butts Lane. Previously reported at Highways Enquiry - 22061683 - Butts Lane, Woodmancote in October 2024. Clearly no action to date. Absentee landowner has responsibility for maintaining this ditch and overgrown hedgerow which blocks water flow and causes flooding down into our house in heavy rain. When the current absentee landowner bought the field the hedgerow was clear back to his fence and the ditch was free flowing. Now the drainage from the fields to the north and east of Butts lane overflows onto the road and into our property and the hedges are so overgrown vehicles are forced across the road and off the tarmac, causing further damage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Butt's Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
